name: client-mongodb

jsDoc.doc: Count result.

Result kind discriminator.

Always `"mongo:count"` for count operations.
Number of documents matching the filter.
Delete result.

Result kind discriminator.

Always `"mongo:delete"` for delete operations.
Number of documents deleted.
FindOne result.

Result kind discriminator.

Always `"mongo:find-one"` for single document queries.
The found document (undefined if not found).
Query result (find, aggregate).

Result kind discriminator.

Always `"mongo:find"` for MongoDB find operations.

Array of documents matching the query.

Includes helper methods like first(), last(), etc.
Insert many result.

Result kind discriminator.

Always `"mongo:insert-many"` for batch inserts.

Array of IDs for inserted documents.

Order matches the input array.
Number of successfully inserted documents.
Insert one result.

Result kind discriminator.

Always `"mongo:insert-one"` for single document inserts.

ID of the inserted document.

Serialized as string for consistency.
Union of all MongoDB result types.
Update result.

Result kind discriminator.

Always `"mongo:update"` for update operations.
Number of documents matching the filter.

Number of documents actually modified.

May be less than matchedCount if documents already had the target values.
ID of the upserted document (present only for upsert operations).

MongoDB connection configuration.

Extends CommonConnectionConfig with MongoDB-specific options.
Database name to connect to.
Authentication database.
Replica set name.
MongoDB document type
Document array with first/last methods

MongoDB filter type (simplified for compatibility with mongodb driver)
Allows query operators like $gte, $lt, $in, etc.

MongoDB update filter type (simplified for compatibility with mongodb driver)
Allows update operators like $set, $inc, $unset, etc.
MongoDB find options
MongoDB update options
MongoDB client configuration.
MongoDB connection URL or configuration object.
Database name to connect to.
MongoDB session interface (for transactions)
MongoDB collection interface
MongoDB client interface
Options for MongoDB errors.
Base error class for MongoDB client errors.
Error thrown when a MongoDB connection cannot be established.
Error thrown when a MongoDB query fails.
Error thrown when a duplicate key constraint is violated.
Error thrown when document validation fails.
Error thrown when a write operation fails.
Error thrown when a document is not found (for firstOrThrow, lastOrThrow).
Create a MongoDocs array from a regular array.

Create a new MongoDB client instance.

The client provides typed collection access, aggregation pipelines,
transaction support, and comprehensive CRUD operations.

tags.doc: A promise resolving to a new MongoDB client instance

Aggregation pipeline
```ts
const result = await users.aggregate<{ _id: string; avgAge: number }>([
  { $group: { _id: "$department", avgAge: { $avg: "$age" } } },
  { $sort: { avgAge: -1 } },
]);
```
